FuncDef:
The ipv6 pd-address-release separate user-type ipoe command enables a device to release only the assigned PD addresses in IPoE access scenarios where CPEs work in numbered routing mode.
The undo ipv6 pd-address-release separate user-type ipoe command disables a device from releasing only PD addresses in IPoE access scenarios where CPEs work in numbered routing mode.
By default, a device cannot release only PD addresses in IPoE access scenarios where CPEs work in numbered routing mode.
CLIs: undo ipv6 pd-address-release separate user-type ipoe
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In IPoE access scenarios where CPEs work in numbered routing mode, the BRAS uses ND to assign IPv6 addresses to WAN interfaces on CPEs and uses PD to assign prefixes to CPEs to generate IPv6 addresses for the attached terminals. By default, the assigned PD addresses and the IPv6 addresses assigned using ND are released at the same time. To enable a device to release only the assigned PD addresses and not the IPv6 addresses assigned using ND for communicating with CPEs, run the ipv6 pd-address-release separate user-type ipoe command. After this command is run, the PD addresses can be released separately.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
This function applies to new access users only.
